channel.title: [Tut] making a Basic login in vb6
channel.description:
Alright so you've make somthing and you want to protect it with a password so no one can get to it without your premission,well you come to the right place. well i dont really want to bother with the interlude so ill get right into it.
step 1:open up the thing you want to protect [IMG]http://i56.photobucket.com/albums/g199/jcs_double/step1.jpg[/img]
Step 2:create a new form and select login dialog [IMG]http://i56.photobucket.com/albums/g199/jcs_double/step2.jpg[/img]
Step 3:double click on the login form to view the source [IMG]http://i56.photobucket.com/albums/g199/jcs_double/step3.jpg[/img]
step 4: insert the code below into where it is shown [code]If txtUsername = "Username" Then[/code] [IMG]http://i56.photobucket.com/albums/g199/jcs_double/step4.jpg[/img]
step 5:click on project at the top and selectproject and scroll down to witch should be down the bottom [projectname] properties and go to startup object and change it to Frmlogin [IMG]http://i56.photobucket.com/albums/g199/jcs_double/step5.jpg[/img]
Final step: close the proerties window and run the program and it will come up with the login Hint: you might want to change the login from username and password to somthing else :|
Enjoy
Edit: please leave some feed back

item.title: [Tut] making a Basic login in vb6
item.dc:creator: @m0u53m4t m0u53m4t
item.description:
@m0u53m4t wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:7, topic:15334”][quote author=m0u53m4t link=topic=22837.msg260107#msg260107 date=1158804933]
Where do you get dissaseblers? If I tried to hack this, could I just use artmoney?
[/quote]
Artmoney is a hex editor, thats different from a disassembler…[/quote]
But say I had a VB program with a label, you can use artmoney to change what it says. Wouldn’t that be easier?

Read full topic
item.source: [Tut] making a Basic login in vb6

item.title: [Tut] making a Basic login in vb6
item.dc:creator: @jcs_double jcs_double
item.description:
@jcs_double wrote:

Alright so you’ve make somthing and you want to protect it with a password so no one can get to it without your premission,well you come to the right place. well i dont really want to bother with the interlude so ill get right into it.

step 1:open up the thing you want to protect

Step 2:create a new form and select login dialog

step2.jpg800×600

Step 3:double click on the login form to view the source

step3.jpg800×600

step 4: insert the code below into where it is shown

If txtUsername = "Username" Then

step4.jpg800×600

step 5:click on project at the top and selectproject and scroll down to witch should be down the bottom [projectname] properties and go to startup object and change it to Frmlogin

step5.jpg800×600

Final step: close the proerties window and run the program and it will come up with the login
Hint: you might want to change the login from username and password to somthing else

Enjoy
